p: The Zika virus (ZIKV) and Dengue virus (DENV) are mosquito-borne enveloped viruses belonging to the Flavivirus genus and constitute a worrisome threat to global human health [ 1, 2]. The genome of flaviviruses consists of a positive-sense single stranded RNA of approximately 11 kb [ 3]. After the viral processing of the polyprotein, ten viral proteins are produced: three structural proteins (C, M and E) and seven nonstructural proteins (NS1, NS2A, NS2B, NS3, NS4A, NS4B and NS5) [ 4]. The E protein mediates the attachment of the viral particles to the host cell membrane [ 5]. This step is necessary for the establishment of the infection [ 6, 7].
